title: Two-Place Predicates
goal: Use `viska`, `tirna`, and `penmi` with both places filled correctly.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Place structure review with klama:

klama — x1 goes to x2 from x3 via x4 using x5

Translate to English:

  1. mi klama la .paris. → ?
  2. la .bob. cu klama la zdani la .london. → ?

(Answers: I go to Paris. Bob goes home from London.)

New Material (5-7 min)

Three Two-Place Gismu

mi viska do — I see you.

Today's gismu each have just two places — simple and common.

Lojban Place Structure English
viska x1 sees x2 see
tirna x1 hears x2 hear
penmi x1 meets x2 meet

Using viska (See)

Lojban Gloss English
mi viska do I see you I see you.
do viska mi you see me You see me.
mi viska la .alis. I see Alice I see Alice.
la .bob. cu viska la gerku Bob [cu] see dog Bob sees a dog.
xu do viska ti [?] you see this Do you see this?

Using tirna (Hear)

Lojban Gloss English
mi tirna do I hear you I hear you.
do tirna la mlatu you hear cat You hear a cat.
la .alis. cu tirna la gerku Alice [cu] hear dog Alice hears a dog.
xu do tirna ti [?] you hear this Do you hear this?

Using penmi (Meet)

Lojban Gloss English
mi penmi do I meet you I meet you.
mi penmi la .bob. I meet Bob I meet Bob.
la .alis. cu penmi la .tam. Alice [cu] meet Tom Alice meets Tom.
xu do penmi la .meris. [?] you meet Mary Do you meet Mary?

Comparing the Three

All three follow the same pattern: x1 [verb]s x2

Gismu x1 x2
viska the seer the seen
tirna the hearer the heard
penmi the meeter the met

Key Point

Two-place gismu have the simplest structure: x1 does something to/with x2. Just fill both slots in order.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Translation (Lojban → English)

  1. mi viska la .paris.
  2. do tirna la gerku
  3. la .bob. cu penmi la .alis.
  4. xu do viska la mlatu
  5. mi tirna do .i do tirna mi
Answers
  1. I see Paris.
  2. You hear a dog.
  3. Bob meets Alice.
  4. Do you see a cat?
  5. I hear you. You hear me.

Exercise 2: Translation (English → Lojban)

  1. I see a dog.
  2. Alice hears Bob.
  3. Do you see this?
  4. I meet you.
  5. Tom sees Mary. Mary sees Tom.
Answers
  1. mi viska la gerku
  2. la .alis. cu tirna la .bob.
  3. xu do viska ti
  4. mi penmi do
  5. la .tam. cu viska la .meris. .i la .meris. cu viska la .tam.

Exercise 3: Build Six Sentences

Create two sentences for each gismu:

viska:

tirna: 3. _______________ 4. _______________

penmi: 5. _______________ 6. _______________

Example answers
  1. mi viska la zdani
  2. la .bob. cu viska la plise
  3. mi tirna la mlatu
  4. do tirna la .alis.
  5. mi penmi la .tam.
  6. la .alis. cu penmi la .meris.

items.answer: I hear you. You hear me.

items.text: Tom sees Mary. Mary sees Tom.
items.answer: `la .tam. cu viska la .meris. .i la .meris. cu viska la .tam.`

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I see you." → mi viska do
  2. "Do you hear this?" → xu do tirna ti
  3. "I meet Alice." → mi penmi la .alis.
  4. "Bob sees a cat. Alice hears a dog." → la .bob. cu viska la mlatu .i la .alis. cu tirna la gerku

Today's Vocab

Lojban Place Structure English
viska x1 sees x2 see
tirna x1 hears x2 hear
penmi x1 meets x2 meet

Summary

You learned three two-place gismu: viska (see), tirna (hear), and penmi (meet). Each follows the pattern x1 [verb]s x2. Fill both places in order to make complete sentences.

Tomorrow preview: You'll learn three-place gismu — dunda (give) and cusku (say) — where you specify what, and to whom.
